title: Spanish Renaissance Wind Music - Piffaro (1997) [Philidor]
description:
Piffaro combines the functions of a traditional "loud ensemble" (cornetts and sackbuts) with a "broken ensemble," or one placing different instruments together that didn't naturally "fit." So it offers cornetts and sackbutts, but its members also perform on recorders, shawms, lute, bagpipes, percussion, and a range of similar Renaissance instruments. Here, they turn their attention to the secular and sacred music of Renaissance Spain, with detailed arrangements such as were common at the time.

Bio of the group included.


You can find all my classical uploads by searching on Philidor, or checking this thread:
 
https://pirates-forum.org/Thread-Philidor-s-uploads--63895
